subject: Cybersecurity
title: Cloud Security: When Your Network Is Everywhere
description: A 60-second lesson on Cloud Security: When Your Network Is Everywhere.

hook.text: Your data isn't in your building anymore. It's in AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud â€” on someone else's computer.

buildup.text: Cloud computing shifts security responsibility. The provider secures the infrastructure; you secure your data.

discovery.text: The 'shared responsibility model' means cloud providers protect the physical servers. You protect everything you put.

twist.text: Most cloud breaches aren't caused by provider failures. They're caused by customers misconfiguring their own S3.

climax.text: The cloud is more secure than most companies' on-premise setups. The risk is misconfiguration by users, not.

punchline.text: The cloud is secure. What you put in it might not be.

quiz.question: What is the most common cause of cloud security breaches?
options: Customer misconfigurations like open S3 buckets
